pageTitle: APOA1 - Apolipoprotein A-I precursor - Homo sapiens (Human)
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {9650=APOA1 mutations may be involved in the pathogenesis of amyloid polyneuropathy-nephropathy Iowa type, also known as amyloidosis van Allen type or familial amyloid polyneuropathy type III (PubMed:3142462 and PubMed:2123470). The clinical picture is dominated by neuropathy in the early stages of the disease and nephropathy late in the course. Death is due in most cases to renal amyloidosis.}
textBeforeTable:
Natural variant Genetic variations in APOA1 can result in APOA1 deficiency and are associated with low levels of HDL cholesterol [Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM)
More..MIMi:107680].

Provides information on polymorphic variants. If the variant is associated with a disease state, the description of the latter can be found in the ‘Involvement in disease’ subsection.
